title: looking for the right font
content:
Dear reader,  
I am looking for the right font for an Identity. I must me a little bit of a Vintage look font, not to serious, not to loose. Maybe something like Futura, only there is a J in the name and I prefer one with the curve, instead of straight down like Futura.  
It also should have O's in the name.  
Maybe someone has tips?

Thanks
author: rozy_

comments.content: If you're looking for something like Futura, but with a curved lowercase "j", you may like Futura's cousin from behind the Iron Curtain, [Super Grotesk](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317145405/http:/www.fontfont.com/fonts/super-grotesk). I think [Brandon Text](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317145405/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/hvdfonts/brandon-text) or [Brandon Grotesque](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317145405/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/hvdfonts/brandon-grotesque) could be fine choices as well, maybe a bit overused as webfonts lately.
Monotype’s Century Gothic also has a curved 'j'. Semplicita has, I believe, a straight 'j' but may well be worth a look.

[http://www.g-type.com/houschka-alt-pro-font](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317145405/http:/www.g-type.com/houschka-alt-pro-font "http://www.g-type.com/houschka-alt-pro-font")  
Try the test drive and style set 2.

How about Verlag? I'm loving the heavier weights and it has the attributes you are looking for...

[Verlag Black](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317145405/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/verlag/characters/verlagblack)

Check out the list of font on the link below. This may help you to choose your desired font.  
 [http://www.fontsquirrel.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317145405/http:/www.fontsquirrel.com/ "http://www.fontsquirrel.com/")
